channel.title: Apparently Quake is evil and is a sign that you hack computers
channel.description:
[url]https://adequacy.org/public/stories/2001.12.2.42056.2147.html[/url]
it's like, 8 years old, but it is still funny as hell...
also...
what's "Lunix" and "Mandrake"?
i believe she ment LINUX and MANDRIVA
oooooh, old people are so funny... :smiley:

item.title: Apparently Quake is evil and is a sign that you hack computers
item.dc:creator: Lamsey
item.description:
Gom _Jabbar:

I think they were mostly fundementel religouse groups seeking a land where they could practice their beleifs openly without predudice. allot of mormons and quakers i think.

And serouisly its not all roses over here, try having a sensible conservation with a middle class daily mail reader about imigration.

Many Americans are descended from poor Scots and Irish people who were forced to emigrate due to poverty (e.g. potato famine) or displacement (e.g. Highland Clearances). Religion wasn’t the main reason.

Read full topic

item.title: Apparently Quake is evil and is a sign that you hack computers
item.dc:creator: Gom_Jabbar
item.description:
The Reverend:

Aside from the last two, I fit the bill.

Yet again I’m threat to the American way without realizing it. -Sigh- I hope I can appeal to St. Peter because the chips are stacked against me.

For you Brits out there, did you send the first Yankees to the Americas by their choice, or were they doing shit like this and you had enough? I realize there are stupid morons anywhere you go in the world, but I have to say I’ve compared some of the shit in the bible belt region especially with most of what I see in the world and I have to say I’m actually impressed with how much more there is.

I think they were mostly fundementel religouse groups seeking a land where they could practice their beleifs openly without predudice. allot of mormons and quakers i think.

And serouisly its not all roses over here, try having a sensible conservation with a middle class daily mail reader about imigration.

item.source: Apparently Quake is evil and is a sign that you hack computers

item.title: Apparently Quake is evil and is a sign that you hack computers
item.dc:creator: eternalness
item.description:
Is this guy serious?

“Quake is an online virtual reality used by hackers. It is a popular meeting place and training ground, where they discuss hacking and train in the use of various firearms. Many hackers develop anti-social tendencies due to the use of this virtual world, and it may cause erratic behaviour at home and at school.”

“If your son has requested a new “processor” from a company called “AMD”, this is genuine cause for alarm. AMD is a third-world based company who make inferior, “knock-off” copies of American processor chips. They use child labor extensively in their third world sweatshops, and they deliberately disable the security features that American processor makers, such as Intel, use to prevent hacking. AMD chips are never sold in stores, and you will most likely be told that you have to order them from internet sites. Do not buy this chip! This is one request that you must refuse your son, if you are to have any hope of raising him well.”

I LOL’d so hard when reading this part.

Read full topic

I realize there are stupid morons anywhere you go in the world, but I have to say I’ve compared some of the shit in the bible belt region especially with most of what I see in the world and I have to say I’m actually impressed with how much more there is.

item.title: Apparently Quake is evil and is a sign that you hack computers
item.dc:creator: Matoking
item.description:
Not serious at all but still very funny.

LMAO!

Popular hacker software includes “Comet Cursor”, “Bonzi Buddy” and “Flash”.

Wikipedia article about Bonzi Buddy : https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bonzi_Buddy

Ummmyeah.

Quake is an online virtual reality used by hackers. It is a popular meeting place and training ground, where they discuss hacking and train in the use of various firearms.

…

8. Is your son obsessed with “Lunix”?

Your son may try to install “lunix” on your hard drive. If he is careful, you may not notice its presence, however, lunix is a capricious beast, and if handled incorrectly, your son may damage your computer, and even break it completely by deleting Windows, at which point you will have to have your computer repaired by a professional.

Really funny.

Read full topic

item.source: Apparently Quake is evil and is a sign that you hack computers

item.title: Apparently Quake is evil and is a sign that you hack computers
item.dc:creator: bountyhunter219
item.description:
Lamsey:

Given that Linux is a derivative of Unix, that misspelling isn’t as silly as you might think. Mandrake Linux is the former name of Mandriva, so it was actually entirely correct at the time of the article’s writing.

I think the final sentence of the article describes it perfectly: “It cannot be taken too seriously”. I refuse to believe that anyone could sincerely hold the opinion that *nix distros are “all versions of an illegal hacker operation system, invented by a Soviet computer hacker named Linyos Torovoltos, before the Russians lost the Cold War.”

well, i guess im wrong there, but i don’t agree with the other things like

buying a processor from AMD is bad, or

all hackers dress like ravers with pacifiers

and the terrible accusation that hackers go outside to socialize…

Read full topic
item.source: Apparently Quake is evil and is a sign that you hack computers

item.title: Apparently Quake is evil and is a sign that you hack computers
item.dc:creator: FlotsamX
item.description:
My son asked me to buy him 2GB of RAM and a new video card for his birthday.

After reading that article, I decided the best course of action would be to beat his ass to the ground, hacking traitor.

Read full topic

item.title: Apparently Quake is evil and is a sign that you hack computers
item.dc:creator: Lamsey
item.description:
Given that Linux is a derivative of Unix, that misspelling isn’t as silly as you might think. Mandrake Linux is the former name of Mandriva, so it was actually entirely correct at the time of the article’s writing.

I think the final sentence of the article describes it perfectly: “It cannot be taken too seriously”. I refuse to believe that anyone could sincerely hold the opinion that *nix distros are “all versions of an illegal hacker operation system, invented by a Soviet computer hacker named Linyos Torovoltos, before the Russians lost the Cold War.”
